policy_implementation_assessment.justification: Selection rates for females (5.78%) and Hispanic (3.61%) and Black (4.46%) applicants fall below the 80-percent rule outlined in §4.6, indicating disparate impact.
specific_violations: §4.6 – Protected-group selection rates below 80 % of highest group (gender and race).
§4.3 – Lack of evidence of diverse interview panels correlated with lower minority/female hires.
recommended_actions: Audit and validate all screening and interview criteria; eliminate factors not job-related.
Expand targeted outreach and advertising to under-represented groups and track applicant flow by stage.
Provide refresher EEO/implicit bias training to all hiring managers and require diverse interview panels.

complaint_trends.seasonal_patterns: Complaints cluster toward the end of each quarter (Feb–Mar, May–Jun, Aug), but no consistent upward or downward trend by type.
